intro: Erucastrum brevirostre, commonly known as the narrow-beaked erucaceous, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant features small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, typical of the family. Its leaves are elongated and have a slightly hairy texture. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, coastal environments.
